p: Analyses of variance showed significant effects of orchard ( P < 0.001) for all of the growth traits measured during the first growing season except for root dry mass ( P = 0.09). The effect of sampling date was also significant for all of the traits measured. The date ∗orchard interaction was significant for the total dry mass ( P = 0.04) and the shoot dry mass ( P = 0.01) only. At the end of the first growing season (1+0)(October 26, 2011), the comparisons of means of shoot dry mass and total dry mass showed no significant differences among seedlings from different orchards. The average height attained was 9.9 ± 1.9 cm whereas the average diameter was 2.7 ± 0.5 mm. The average dry masses were 0.93 ± 0.29 g for shoots, 0.38 ± 0.12 g for roots, and 1.31 ± 0.39 g for the entire seedling.
